definition: to gather/to collect/collected works/classifier for sections of a TV series etc: episode
round/lump/ball/to roll into a ball/to gather/regiment/group/society/classifier for a lump or a soft mass: wad (of paper), ball (of wool), cloud (of smoke)

sentences.english: Interest group comes from some people's maintenance of common interests.
sentences.chinese: 利益集团来自于部分人对共同利益的维护。

sentences.english: When actually, the instigators were you and your interest groups.
sentences.chinese: 其实，始作俑者就是你和你的利益集团。

sentences.english: The American political system makes it hard to displace entrenched interest groups.
sentences.chinese: 美国的政治体制使得根深蒂固的利益集团难以被取代。

sentences.english: But his saying of "not representing any interest group" would be hardly convinced.
sentences.chinese: 但赵先生说他不代表利益集团，恐怕难以服众。

sentences.english: The governments acted as if they were corporations seeking to settle embarrassing lawsuits.
sentences.chinese: 政府成了试图平息一宗棘手的法律纠纷的利益集团。

sentences.english: From this, only then interference of letter interest group says legislatively to be not unfounded.
sentences.chinese: 由此，始信利益集团干扰立法之说并非虚妄。

definition: centralized power (history), e.g. under an Emperor or party
to check and balance (power)/checks and balances
